ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Proposal to change how bard haste songs stack with  enchanter/sham an haste spells
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I m not that far behind you, almost 36 now.  It has gotten better than it was in the early 20 s that s for certain.  But in the 8-12th level range I was
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I'm not that far behind you, almost 36 now. It has gotten better than
it was in the early 20's that's for certain. But in the 8-12th level range
I was constantly amazed at what I could do with a little tactical
forethought. Nowadays I'm mostly amazed at what I can't do that it would
seem I should be able to. I'm the only hybrid in the guild that can't stand
up to a mob that's barely green to me and not lose 4 bubbles of health.
Admittedly I can fear chains it, but even then I usually take 1-2 bubbles
due to resists. Our druid can kill 4 of the same mob all at once.

In a group I see my flexibility increase, I can fill nearly whatever role
the group is missing, but in most of the groups I've been in they aren't
missing any key element. They usually have a healer, a tank, a nuker, and a
crowd controller. The next two slots generally get filled with whatever is
available and if its me it means I'm expected to play manasong nearly
continuously. Oh and help tank. Fortunately most groups don't actually
threaten to kick me out when I refuse to just play manasong in actual
combat.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 11, 2001 2:18 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Proposal to change how bard haste songs stack
with enchanter/sham an haste spells


Hehehe.. well of course I'm talking out my butt cuz i'm only 39.. maybe it
really gets WORSE.
Or maybe the hard periods are different for every player.. dunno :)

Hally/Tani

> with enchanter/sham an haste spells

>
> That's funny. My hard period was around level 23-26. Of
> course, back then
> Lullaby was an actual song, not a flashy method of suicide.
> Levels 8-12
> were my favorites for a long while I think, Lament and Bellow
> were extremely
> useful back then and Warsong was still pretty new. Carillion is still
> probably the biggest non-roleplaying reason I don't quit
> playing my bard.
>
> Kit
